appSettings.title: App Settings
appSettings.jwtRenewHelp: When an access token has this many seconds or fewer remaining, the client will proactively refresh it (as long as the refresh token is still valid). Set to 0 to disable proactive renewal. Tip: keep this well below the access-token lifetime (e.g., 120–300 seconds).
appSettings.idleTimeoutHelp: Maximum time (in seconds) a session can be idle with no API activity before the refresh token expires. After this, the user must sign in again. Typical range: 900–3600. Higher values keep users signed in longer; lower values are more secure.
appSettings.accessLifetimeHelp: Lifetime (in seconds) of each access token. After it expires, requests require a refresh to obtain a new access token. Shorter is more secure but requires more frequent refreshes. Typical range: 300–1800. Recommended to keep this less than the idle timeout.
appSettings.noteNewSessions: Saved settings will be applied on the next login.
